citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection the program of veterinary care was incomplete. The previous attending veterinarian had not yet
agreed to provide care for the facility for the 2024 season.
The written program of veterinary care affirms that both the facility and attending veterinarian understand their respective
roles to provide appropriate care for the species housed. Facilities with consultant veterinarians must ensure that a written
program of veterinary care is available for review during all USDA inspections that accurately documents the
arrangements set forth at each facility.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 6/8/2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and
must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
All three sites used for regulated activity must demonstrate full compliance with the Animal Welfare Act prior to issuance
of a license. Regulated activity may continue at all regulated sites until expiration of the current license (4/9/10). At that
time, conducting regulated activity from any site without a valid USDA license is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
At the time of inspection the program of veterinary care was incomplete. The previous attending veterinarian had not yet 
agreed to provide care for the facility for the 2024 season.  
 
The written program of veterinary care affirms that both the facility and attending veterinarian understand their respective 
roles to provide appropriate care for the species housed. Facilities with consultant veterinarians must ensure that a written 
program of veterinary care is available for review during all USDA inspections that accurately documents the 
arrangements set forth at each facility. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 6/8/2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and 
must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
All three sites used for regulated activity must demonstrate full compliance with the Animal Welfare Act prior to issuance 
of a license. Regulated activity may continue at all regulated sites until expiration of the current license (4/9/10). At that 
time, conducting regulated activity from any site without a valid USDA license is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act. 
 
 n
